posts.post_content: Don't think of it as an overcosted beater, think of it as an insanely undercosted discard spell. It's entirely possible to hit once with this guy on turn four and make your opponent drop his entire hand.

posts.post_content:
Wow, why is this card rated this low? This guy is a beast!  
  
In my UB proliferate/infect deck this baby can go something like this:  
  
T1: Swamp, whatever  
T2: Swamp, [Trigon of Rage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trigon of Rage)  
T3: Island, [Whispering Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispering Specter)  
T4: Pump it with Trigon of Rage, hit for 4 poison, sac it and opponent discards 4 cards. GG! And I still have a U mana open for [Turn Aside](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turn Aside) in case my opponent goes for removal  
  
If thats not a game ender I don't know what is....

Posted By: RJ.693 (5/13/2011 1:52:37 PM)

posts.post_content:
Slap a [Lashwrithe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lashwrithe) and watch the cards fall out of your opponent's hand.  
  
T1: Swamp, Your choice of discard spell  
T2: Swamp, [Plague Stinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Stinger)  
T3: Swamp, [Whispering Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispering Specter)  
T4: Swamp, [Lashwrithe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lashwrithe), pay 4 life, swing for a potential full hand dump  
  
This card isn't anywhere near as bad as some say, but it's definitely not the sexy choice, especially with [Phyrexian Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Crusader) the go to 3 drop. I run a mono black infect deck that runs a lot of hand disruption and when I connect with my Specter it usually empties the rest of their hand. In the right deck he can fly pretty high.  
  
3.5/5
posts.html:
Slap a Lashwrithe and watch the cards fall out of your opponent's hand.

T1: Swamp, Your choice of discard spell
T2: Swamp, Plague Stinger
T3: Swamp, Whispering Specter
T4: Swamp, Lashwrithe, pay 4 life, swing for a potential full hand dump

This card isn't anywhere near as bad as some say, but it's definitely not the sexy choice, especially with Phyrexian Crusader the go to 3 drop. I run a mono black infect deck that runs a lot of hand disruption and when I connect with my Specter it usually empties the rest of their hand. In the right deck he can fly pretty high.

3.5/5

Posted By: Deco_y (6/7/2011 1:08:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I originally gave this card a rating of 2 when New Phyrexia was first unveiled. After trying him out in a mono-black infect deck, he isn't *quite* as bad as I had originally thought, though his usefulness is quite conditional.  
  
**I still think he is a bit underpowered. With powered up cards like [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator) running rampant, I doubt him having a slightly bigger P/T would have broken the format. However, I've bumped him up from a 2 to a 3 for a final rating**.  
  
I still think he should have costed ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), (or better yet, ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Phyrexian Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=BP&type=symbol)) but in the right deck, yes, this guy can shine for you. If you are planning on decking him, I'd suggest using him alongside cards like [Distortion Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distortion Strike) or [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak). If he lands his combat damage late-game its true he can be devastating, but an opponent will hardly ever allow that to happen.  
  
The artwork is really incredible.
posts.html:
I originally gave this card a rating of 2 when New Phyrexia was first unveiled. After trying him out in a mono-black infect deck, he isn't quite as bad as I had originally thought, though his usefulness is quite conditional.

I still think he is a bit underpowered. With powered up cards like Phyrexian Obliterator running rampant, I doubt him having a slightly bigger P/T would have broken the format. However, I've bumped him up from a 2 to a 3 for a final rating.

I still think he should have costed , (or better yet, ) but in the right deck, yes, this guy can shine for you. If you are planning on decking him, I'd suggest using him alongside cards like Distortion Strike or Whispersilk Cloak. If he lands his combat damage late-game its true he can be devastating, but an opponent will hardly ever allow that to happen.

The artwork is really incredible.
